eventName: Hespeler Village Market					- This event has already occurred
description: The Hespeler Village Market is a seasonal, outdoor, urban farmers' market that focuses on the importance of building community connections and supporting local businesses. Visit us on Fridays during our 2023 season to shop at a diverse mix of food and artisan vendors, to find out about local charities and community groups at our community booth, and to enjoy our entertainment. Stop by our gazebo for something hot to eat. We also have plenty for the kids to do in our Kid's Zone. For more information check out our website.

eventName: Cambridge Farmers' Market					- This event has already occurred
description: Ask yourself a few simple questions….Our hope is that you answered, “Yes,” to all of the above questions, and that’s what we love about food: It is a common bond we all share, a single thread that when talked about, brings to mind all sorts of stories and experiences that we can share.Farmers’ markets are a centre of commerce and socializing, a venue for combining old with new and a place for new ideas to be explored and celebrated.The Cambridge Farmers’ Market (CFM) is our community food hub. It is where residents gather to talk about food and community happenings. It’s where awareness is built and the beginnings of change takes place.The CFM dates back to the 1830s with the current market building holding its seat on Dickson Street since 1887. The presence of the market in conjunction with other civic structures, the Town Halls, is an English tradition that is as relevant today as it was when the market was built.The CFM building’s continued use as a market is unique in Ontario. While other markets either remain outdoors only or have had their original buildings converted for other uses, the CFM has continued to flourish in its original location in its original building for its original intended use and this should be celebrated.As you explore the market, the sweet and spicy aromas of hot prepared foods and snacks will tempt you, along with an extensive selection of cheeses, chutneys, pies, confections, specialty oils, preserves, and seasonal fruits and vegetables.A wide range of local growers and food producers can supply you with all your needs from savoury appetizers to mouth-watering desserts.Our market wouldn’t exist without those dedicated vendors, some of whom have been a part of our team for over 50 years. They arrive in the snow and in the rain, or in the heat of summer, often setting up as early as 3:30 in the morning and many don’t pack up until more than 12 hours later.We have 26 year-round vendors and 30 seasonal vendors, averaging 56 vendors at the peak of the market season, who supply approximately 35,000 shopper visits each year.You can learn more about our vendors by visiting the vendor directory on our website, cambridgefarmersmarket.ca.The Cambridge Farmers' Market is open Saturdays from 7 am to 1 pm, year-round. It is located at the corner of Ainslie Street and Dickson Street, in the heart of downtown Cambridge, and parking is available nearby.For more information, visit cambridgefarmersmarket.ca

eventName: Galt Jazz					- This event has already occurred
description: Galt Jazz presents live music on Main Street from 2-5pm on the first Sunday of every month from June until October. Come and enjoy great professional bands in the lovely setting of our quaint downtown pedestrian block.Bring a chair, relax, enjoy!

eventName: Art Hop					- This event has already occurred
description: This year, KW is the final frontier. Art Hop is back and with it comes the wildest art and music festival in the region. Embark on an intergalactic journey through the extraordinary and enchanting with 7 out-of-this world creative experiences wrapped up in a 2-day festival. Celebrate the best and boldest artists that call Kitchener-Waterloo home, immerse yourself in the arts, and explore your community.

eventName: Nature, Music & Art at Mill Race Park					- This event has already occurred
description: 'Let's Reconnect with Our Surroundings, Each Other and Ourselves as we Celebrate Cambridge's 50th Anniversary!'Pack a picnic, bring your dog, ride your bike! This is a waste conscious day of local art and culture, anchored by a community cleanup. The day will open with an Indigenous Ceremony hosted by Crow Shield Lodge. The Soenen Sisters will follow with the cello and harp, followed by CJ Cooper and her acoustic guitar. T43 will closeout the day with folk. There is a wheelchair accessible Market Lane along the Grand River (O:se Kenhionhata:tie), where everyone is welcome! Meet Mayor Jan Liggett as she will be handing out Ice Cream, or check out the Cambridge Fire Truck! Neuron Mobile will have a Demonstration Station in the parking lot, while Red Raccoon Bike Rescue will be doing Free Bicycle Tune-Ups beside them! Drinking water will be available to all. Enjoy various Free Workshops including a Guided Mural Photography Tour, Guided Meditation by the River and Guided Walking Tours of Historic Galt. Materials for the Community Cleanup will be supplied.  Meet environmental nonprofits and support the Cambridge Humane Society in their Shelter Supply Drive.  This event is intended to be highly accessible, inclusive, and relatively barrier-free. We hope to see you there!

description: Cambridge Community Clean UpSaturday September 16, 2023    9:30- 12 noonPick up your supplies at Idea Exchange locationsMore than 10+ people in your group or want to do a clean up on a different date?  Contact Paul Willms willmsp@cambridge.ca at least 3 days in advance of your event for suppliesOnce you're done, use our handy app at www.Cambridge.ca/CleanupRequest to get your bags picked upRain or Shine...pick up your supplies on September 16th but you can do your clean up anytime!

eventName: Cambridge Newcomer Connections 					- This event has already occurred
description: The Cambridge Newcomer Connections event aims to provide an inclusive platform for newcomers to Canada and ethno-cultural communities to explore and familiarize themselves with local programs and services available to them and their families. Community is central to helping people attain and maintain wellbeing and health. This event aims to facilitate meaningful connections and social networking by encouraging newcomers to engage with one another and establish a supportive social network within the community.

description: Join in for a walk or fun-run to help protect and conserve land in Waterloo Region and Wellington County. The 2023 Trail Party's Walk & Run for rare supports our Turn the Map Green campaign where every $2 raised protects 1 square metre of environmentally sensitive land now and for the future. If you want to get outdoors to support nature with your family, friends, children, or co-workers, join us to Turn the Map Green one step at a time.Three different routes to choose from:Included with registration:

eventName: Cambridge Terry Fox Run					- This event has already occurred
description: The annual Terry Fox Run has become a fall tradition in Canada, with more than 650 communities, fundraising for cancer research. This year, you can register and participate in the Cambridge Terry Fox Run on Sunday September 17th!  Join us at Riveside Park to run, walk or wheel the 5km route!  Check in at 11am, Official Start at 12pm.  Visit terryfox.org/run for more details or visit Cambridge Terry Fox Run on Facebook or Instagram.

eventName: Take Back the Night Rally and March					- This event has already occurred
description: Take Back the Night is a powerful opportunity to celebrate, support and recognize survivors of sexual and gender based violence. It connects community with organizations and folks working to end gender based violence and who can support survivors in their healing, it is a reclaiming of the right to walk the streets free from the fear of violence and a time when we can come together to rally and march in resistance.We will meet at The W (20 Dickson St Cambridge) a community space operated by YWCA Cambridge, where you are welcome to gather and connect with community organizations inside. Outside there will be sign making, sidewalk chalking and button making. The rally will take place out front of the building and the march begins there.This event and YWCA Cambridge is located on the Haldimand Tract, land promised to the Haudenosaunee people of the Six Nations, which includes six miles on either side of the Grand River. This territory is the traditional territory of the Neutral, Anishnaabeg and Haudenosaunee Peoples. Understanding and working toward the elimination of sexual and gender based violence must also include an understanding and commitment to decolonization and include Indigenous people of this land.All genders are welcome to take part in this event. This will be a youth and family-friendly event.Schedule:6 p.m. - The W and community organization booths are open to the community; join us for sign and button making and sidewalk chalking6:30 p.m. - Youth-led rally begins7 p.m. - March in downtown Cambridge beginsFacebook event page: https://facebook.com/events/s/take-back-the-night-2023/280681117884283/

eventName: TREEmendous Cambridge Walking Tours - Galt					- This event has already occurred
description: TREEmendous Cambridge Walking Tours - GaltJoin Cambridge City Green volunteers and arboris Aaron Boonstra of Reep Green Solutions on a walking tour of TREEmendous Cambridge street trees.Learn about Cambridge City Green’s new tool, “TREEmendous Cambridge” which lets youAaron Boonstra will lead three walks to see the various large trees along Cambridge streets and talk about urban forestry issues.  Cambridge City Green volunteers will demonstrate the TREEmendous Cambridge tool along the way.Galt - Thursday September 21st 6:30-8pm – park / meet at Lincoln Park parking lot, 14 Vimy St..  Walk will be approximately 2km, some through the turf of the park, with the majority along the sidewalks of the neighbourhood.  Limited to 20 people – register at this Eventbrite link. Rain or shine, but in case of thunderstorm the walk will be cancelled.

eventName: WIGG Pop-Up with Lynn Spence					- This event has already occurred
description: Women's International Gift & Gallery, a social enterprise operated by YWCA Cambridge, is hosting a pop-up! Featuring customer favourites such as Bryn Walker, Sympli, Paolo Tricot and more, this 3-day pop-up shop will feature special appearances by style icon Lynn Spence, a fashion show and great deals! Shop beautiful things for a beautiful cause. All proceeds support YWCA Cambridge's free community-based programming with youth and women. Learn more about WIGG at wiggonline.com. Learn about YWCA Cambridge at ywcacambidge.ca

eventName: Jenny's Place - by Don Van Galen presented by Cambridge Community Players					- This event has already occurred
description: Written by Don Van Galen of St. Mary's, Ontario, Jenny's Place is the story of a woman who moves to a prairie town in Saskatchewan in the 1880s to try to start a new life by reopening a rundown boarding house. During this time, the local minister, a snobby mayor’s wife, gamblers and an old romantic flame serve up a series of comedic misunderstandings and witty schemes.September 22nd through October 1st at the Cambridge Arts Theatre (47 Water Street South).Tickets are $25 for adults and $20 for students and can be purchased at www.cambridgecommunityplayers.com.

eventName: Cambridge Grown, Celebrating 50 years with the City of Cambridge. 					- This event has already occurred
description: Cambridge Grown is a Culture Days event that's focus is on the role of Agriculture and the Cambridge Farmers Market since Amalgamation in 1973!Baked Potato BBQ with all the “fixin's”, 9am-12pm (In honor of the creation of the Yukon Gold Potato at the University of Guelphin the late 1960 early 70's)Tractor Photo Op, 9am-12pmCreate your own Chia Pet, 9am-12pm (Popular Children's Craft from the 1970's)Sonshine and Broccoli (Child's Entertainer), 10am-11amWandering Stilt Walkers throughout the dayPhoto Retrospective of the Cambridge Farmers Market from the 1830's to Present DayFree Reusable Bag give away (while supplies last)

eventName: Kidney Walk					- This event has already occurred
description: Kidney Walks are a province-wide movement to raise funds to better the lives of our loved ones affected by kidney disease. It’s a time to celebrate, make connections, remember, andsupport each other to demonstrate the strength of our kidney community. When you join the Kidney Walk, your joining thousands of Canadians who believe that we can make a difference - because Together We are Stronger than Kidney Disease. We hope you will join us at the Waterloo Kidney Walk on September 24 and be part of our kidney community. The Kidney Walk raises crucial funds to support kidney disease research, and programs and services designed to improve the lives of Canadians living with kidney disease and those who care for them.

eventName: Spotlight on Seniors Trade Show					- This event has already occurred
description: The 'Spotlight on Seniors Trade Show' is a free annual event focusing on providing information and connection with our local senior community members and their families.Come and enjoy 25+ vendors, demonstrations, giveaways, refreshments and door prizes!• Retirement Residences • Real Estate • Fashion • Downsizing Experts • Diabetes Information • Wills & Power of Attorney • Finances • Hearing • Exercise & SO MUCH MORE!

eventName: Support the Beat - Dance to the Beat Fundraiser					- This event has already occurred
description: Join us for a fun filled evening featuring the live music of Van Morrison in support of St Mary’s Cardiac Unit.This special evening will include Canapes* (Tapas)*, a silent auction and will feature the music of Van Morrison and Classic Hits, performed by a 6 piece band featuring Matt Weidinger.All of us have in some way been affected by those who have suffered from heart disease….the silent killer. One of the reasons we decided to start this event was the sudden loss of our dear friend, business associate and hockey defense partner, Dave Thomson (DT) who passed away Feb. 28, 2021 suffering from a massive heart attack at the young age of 48.This evening serves as not only a salute to Dave but also allows us to raise highly needed funds for an organization that works for all of us.*Please note, Canapes and Tapas are available with the "Early Entry" Tickets only.

eventName: Our Love of Fabric Quilt Show					- This event has already occurred
description: Busy Hands Quilt Guild and Pieces and Patches Quilters' Guild of Cambridge present the "Our Love of Fabric" Quilt Show. Over 200 beautiful, handcrafted quilts will be on display. The show will also offer refreshments, door prizes, giveaways and vendors selling fabrics and notions. Free parking and buses welcome.

eventName: Cambridge Farmers' Market					- This event has already occurred
description: Ask yourself a few simple questions….Our hope is that you answered, “Yes,” to all of the above questions, and that’s what we love about food: It is a common bond we all share, a single thread that when talked about, brings to mind all sorts of stories and experiences that we can share.Farmers’ markets are a centre of commerce and socializing, a venue for combining old with new and a place for new ideas to be explored and celebrated.The Cambridge Farmers’ Market (CFM) is our community food hub. It is where residents gather to talk about food and community happenings. It’s where awareness is built and the beginnings of change takes place.The CFM dates back to the 1830s with the current market building holding its seat on Dickson Street since 1887. The presence of the market in conjunction with other civic structures, the Town Halls, is an English tradition that is as relevant today as it was when the market was built.The CFM building’s continued use as a market is unique in Ontario. While other markets either remain outdoors only or have had their original buildings converted for other uses, the CFM has continued to flourish in its original location in its original building for its original intended use and this should be celebrated.As you explore the market, the sweet and spicy aromas of hot prepared foods and snacks will tempt you, along with an extensive selection of cheeses, chutneys, pies, confections, specialty oils, preserves, and seasonal fruits and vegetables.A wide range of local growers and food producers can supply you with all your needs from savoury appetizers to mouth-watering desserts.Our market wouldn’t exist without those dedicated vendors, some of whom have been a part of our team for over 50 years. They arrive in the snow and in the rain, or in the heat of summer, often setting up as early as 3:30 in the morning and many don’t pack up until more than 12 hours later.We have 26 year-round vendors and 30 seasonal vendors, averaging 56 vendors at the peak of the market season, who supply approximately 35,000 shopper visits each year.You can learn more about our vendors by visiting the vendor directory on our website, cambridgefarmersmarket.ca.The Cambridge Farmers' Market is open Saturdays from 7 am to 1 pm, year-round. It is located at the corner of Ainslie Street and Dickson Street, in the heart of downtown Cambridge, and parking is available nearby.For more information, visit cambridgefarmersmarket.ca

eventName: Our Love of Fabric Quilt Show					- This event has already occurred
description: Busy Hands Quilt Guild and Pieces and Patches Quilters' Guild of Cambridge present the "Our Love of Fabric" Quilt Show. Over 200 beautiful, handcrafted quilts will be on display. The show will also offer refreshments, door prizes, giveaways and vendors selling fabrics and notions. Free parking and buses welcome.

eventName: Jenny's Place - by Don Van Galen presented by Cambridge Community Players					- This event has already occurred
description: Written by Don Van Galen of St. Mary's, Ontario, Jenny's Place is the story of a woman who moves to a prairie town in Saskatchewan in the 1880s to try to start a new life by reopening a rundown boarding house. During this time, the local minister, a snobby mayor’s wife, gamblers and an old romantic flame serve up a series of comedic misunderstandings and witty schemes.September 22nd through October 1st at the Cambridge Arts Theatre (47 Water Street South).Tickets are $25 for adults and $20 for students and can be purchased at www.cambridgecommunityplayers.com.

eventName: Galt Jazz
description: Galt Jazz presents live music on Main Street from 2-5pm on the first Sunday of every month from June until October. Come and enjoy great professional bands in the lovely setting of our quaint downtown pedestrian block.Bring a chair, relax, enjoy!

eventName: 2023 Cambridge Oktoberfest Lunch
description: Join us at Cambridge City Hall for the Mayor's 2023 Cambridge Oktoberfest Lunch! Enjoy free sausages, bavarian music, keg tapping and fun!

eventName: Cambridgelicious
description: This fall, have a deliciously local experience at the first ever Cambridgelicious, taking place from October 13 - 22, 2023.

eventName: Doggie Yoga with Autism Dog Services
description: Appealing to all yoga levels, participants will be instructed by local certified yoga instructor Gwyn Rafuse-Smith of Karmic Yoga, while being surrounded by Autism Dog Services service dogs in training. Particpants can bring their own yoga mat, towel and bottled water. Tickets are $20 and all proceeds will benefit Autism Dog Services.

eventName: Walk A Mile In The Shoes in support of YWCA Cambridge
description: Walk A Mile in Their Shoes is an annual fundraising event for people of all ages, gender identities and abilities to increase awareness of the impacts of gender-based violence, while raising much-needed funds to support YWCA Cambridge’s GBV prevention work.We’re on a mission to not only end gender-based violence, but prevent it before it can happen. That’s why we work tirelessly to provide free, community-based violence prevention programming to youth across Cambridge, North Dumfries and beyond.Mark your calendars and walk in solidarity with survivors of violence. Together we have the ability to make our community a safer space for all and put an end to gender-based violence.

eventName: TREEmendous Cambridge Walking Tours - Preston
description: TREEmendous Cambridge Walking Tours - PrestonJoin Cambridge City Green volunteers and Aaron Boonstra, Arborist with Reep Green Solutions, on a walking tour of the TREEmendous Cambridge street trees.  Learn about Cambridge City Green’s new tool, “TREEmendous Cambridge” which lets youAaron Boonstra will lead three walks to see the various large trees along Cambridge streets and talk about urban forestry issues.  Cambridge City Green volunteers will demonstrate the TREEmendous Cambridge tool along the way.Preston - Saturday October 14th 2-3:30 pm – park / meet at 932 Dover St. S. (parking is very limited and you may have to park on-street).  Walk will be approximately 2km, half on stonedust trail (Bob McMullen trail), half on City sidewalks through the neighbourhood.  Limited to 20 people – register at this Eventbrite link.  Rain or shine, but in case of thunderstorm the walk will be cancelled.

location.name: 932 Dover St. S. (parking is very limited and you may have to park on street nearby)

eventName: Launch of Waterloo Region's 2023 Vital Signs Report
description: Waterloo Region Community Foundation has worked with local experts and consultants to research and create Waterloo Region's 2023 Vital Signs® Report focused on Affordable Housing. Please join them on Thursday, October 19, 2023 at 1:00 pm for a webinar where they will present the report, key findings and discuss opportunities for its use in our community. All attendees will receive a link to the full report after the session.

eventName: ECU - a Division of WFCU Credit Union Trick or Trot
description: This October, we are proud to host Waterloo Region’s inaugural ECU – a Division of WFCU Credit Union Trick or Trot! A Halloween-themed 5K Run, 5K Walk, and 1K or 250m Kids Dash, this new community event offers family fun you won’t want to miss!Alongside the 5K Run, 5K Walk, and Kids Dash, we will be hosting a Halloween Costume Contest. Come dressed in your favourite costume for the chance to win! Costumes are not required to participate in any of the race events but are encouraged.Join us before and after the race for awards, music, and activities!Proceeds from this event will benefit Food4Kids Waterloo Region, a local organization that addresses the childhood hunger crisis present in our community. We will be collecting non-perishable foods at the event to donate to Food4Kids. Bring your food donations in exchange for a Halloween Treat!
